ygData.subject: RE: Wisdom Does Effect Trade Skills
ygData.msgSnippet: hehe ok, was just postulating another theory, but simply because someone thinks that it is true, does not make it so.  And like I said, this theory of
ygData.messageBody:
hehe ok, was just postulating another theory, but simply because someone
"thinks" that it is true, does not make it so. And like I said, this
"theory" of wisdom started way back in Beta, and you should know that if
enough people say it, then eventually everybody believes it.... All I know
is that I too am doing jewelry, along with Fletching, and I have a 74
Wisdom. I have roughly the same failure rate (I was keeping track) as
another jeweler with wisdom over 100.... So does anyone really know for
sure??? I say no, no one other than an employee looking at the code can say
"Yes, wisdom does raise the chances of success"

So to say it is FACT is a misstatement, because you can't know that. I was
merely posting some curious results I got from a low wisdom, high dexterity
character, stating that it seemed odd that I had a pretty good success rate
with a low wisdom and a high strength. If this helps, I minored in Math in
College and do understand statistics, so I do know that the 25 to 50 data
points that I have are not that good an idicator, but it was curious is all.

Vapn, Master Fletcher (3 pts shy of that magical 200), Povar

-----Original Message-----
From: srutkowski@... [mailto:srutkowski@...]
Sent: Wednesday, October 13, 1999 2:52 PM
To: EQ_Fletchers@onelist.com
Subject: [EQ_Fletchers] Wisdom Does Effect Trade Skills


From: srutkowski@...



One major case in fact- EVERY jeweler (master and above) out there has a set
of
equipment for jeweling- wisdom being the main factor after skill to
determine
failures, then intelligence to raise skills.

I tried this with my cleric- started by brewing, but also on some low level
jewelry, baking and tailoring stuff. I was able to reliably make items that
other characters could not make reliably, even though these other characters
had
much more dex (145 vs 110), agi (138 vs 85), and between 10-20 skill points
more
than I did. My wisdom is 178, thiers 70.

If you don't believe that, ask a jeweler or go check out the enchanters
board
(www.eqcastersrealm.com)
